document.docAuthor: Albuquerque, Felícia Pereira De, Manfio, Daiara & Ribeiro-Costa, Cibele Stramare
document.masterDocTitle: A contribution to the knowledge of New World Bruchinae (Coleoptera, Chrysomelidae): taxonomic revision of Ctenocolum Kingsolver & Whitehead, with description of five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A contribution to the knowledge of New World Bruchinae (Coleoptera, Chrysomelidae): taxonomic revision of Ctenocolum Kingsolver & Whitehead, with description of five new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ctenocolum martiale
Kingsolver & Whitehead ( 1974 a)

subSubSection.paragraph:

Note. Kingsolver & Whitehead ( 1974 ) quoted the holotype is deposited in the USNM and the thirteen paratypes in the CNC and USNM . The holotype and the eight paratypes received from USNM were examined and coincide with the description.

Lonchocarpus eriocarinalis
( USNM ); 3 , La Huerta, Rancho Cuixmala, 1992 , # 1033 , L. Rico col., reared seeds
Lonchocarpus eriocarinalis
( TAMU ). Michoacán: 1, 13 km W Playa Azul,

1172 - 79
, C. D. Johnson col., same host plant ( TAMU ).

Diagnosis.
Ctenocolum martiale
is different from
C. milelo
,
C. podagricus
and
C. triangulatus
by having striae 3 and 4 of elytra with conspicuous teeth at base. This species differs from all other species mainly by the male genitalia with the internal sac bilobate, elongate with dense spines and the presence of a hollow sclerite (
Fig. 81
).

Integument. Dorsum in general black and reddish brown. Antenna brown and dark brown, sometimes first 3 antennomeres paler ( Figs. 11, 12 ). Pygidium reddish brown or reddish brown and black or rufous. Ventral region reddish brown and black sometimes adding brown. Front and middle femur and tibia variegated from pale brown to dark brown and reddish brown; hind femur reddish brown and from dark brown to black.

Note.
Kingsolver & Whitehead ( 1974 a)
remarked that the pubescence of
C. martiale
is sexually dimorphic dorsally. Because we studied more specimens than the authors (
Kingsolver & Whitehead 1974 a
), it was possible to conclude that the pubescence color pattern on the dorsum corresponds to intraspecific variation (Figs. 11,12).
Distribution. Neotropical region: Mexico (Nayarit, Jalisco, Veracruz, Michoacán, Guerrero, Oaxaca), Trinidad and Tobago ( Trinidad ).

Host plants (Tables I–II). Papilionoideae :
Lonchocarpus constrictus Pittier
,
L. eriocarinalis Micheli.
,
L. sericeus (Poir.)
DC. (=
L. cruentus Lundell
).
